author: Muralidhara Khajane
text:
Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who has come under criticism from the Opposition for receiving an expensive watch as gift, on Saturday took an indirect dig at the Opposition saying: “Those who raise their voice for social justice and speak in favour of the voiceless oppressed class are bound to get targeted and all attempts will be made to silence them …”

During his reply to the Governor’s address to the joint session of the State legislature, he accused the Opposition of trying to tarnish his image for fighting for the cause of the backward classes. He said history was replete with instances of this kind. “This is what happened to Basavanna in the 12th century, and Gandhiji and Ambedkar in the 20th century. Champion of backward classes D. Devaraj Urs suffered because of his concern for the backward classes,” he said.

“I did not become Chief Minister overnight. I know how difficult it is for a backward class leader to become the Chief Minister and I also know the fact that it is equally difficult to be in power,” Mr. Siddaramaiah said, indirectly attacking those allegedly trying to destabilise his government.

He said he did not have a single black mark in his political career.

Noting that society would not benefit by attacking the private life of any person, he said, “If a leader worked against the interest of society, that should be brought to the public notice with the support of facts, figures and documents.”

He accused Opposition of trying to tarnish his image; refutes BJP charge of govt. being inactive
title: Champions of backward classes are bound to be targeted: Siddaramaiah
